item.name: 7 Wonders: Duel
item.comment: Great 2 player version of 7 Wonders. New mechanics are interesting and work great with 2 players. Game is a lot more confrontational than 7 Wonders though; everything you do affects your opponents, and vice versa.

item.name: Aargh!Tecte
item.comment: Had heard great things about it, every play session has been a rollicking good time. Doesn't get out much (perfect for big groups with non-gamers, less with serious or active gamers.)

item.name: Android: Netrunner
item.comment: Bought it for the art. Never thought I'd like it so much that I'd buy every single pack that came out. Even continued to buy the new packs when I moved to a city that didn't have a Netrunner scene (and I didn't have the time anymore to play). Finding coworkers that got into it meant that this went back from "collecting game for art" to "getting all cards to play at lunch"

item.name: Android: Netrunner – A Study in Static
Android: Netrunner – The Universe of Tomorrow
Ashes: Rise of the Phoenixborn
item.comment: Bought on impulse, after seeing user reviews saying that if you liked Netrunner, you should play this. Never got into Magic, but Netrunner is my favorite 2 player game, so was intrigued and happy that this Netrunner/Magic mashup is so fun.

item.name: Back to the Future: The Card Game
item.comment: Love time travel, so bought on a whim. Interesting mechanic, but rapidly devolves into a "I switch this card" "Then I reswitch it!" (repeat ad infinitum until someone decides to try another approach)

item.name: Belle of the Ball
item.comment: Kickstarter

item.name: Betrayal at House on the Hill
Castle Dice
item.comment: Kickstarter

item.name: DrunkQuest
item.comment: Kickstarter

item.name: Exploding Kittens
item.comment:
Kickstarter
Fun quick filler game. Has elimination, but games are generally over fast.

item.name: Exploding Kittens: NSFW Deck
item.comment: Kickstarter

item.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Urban Structures
Guts of Glory
item.comment: Kickstarter

item.name: Jungle Ascent
item.comment: Kickstarter

item.name: Kill Doctor Lucky... and His Little Dog, Too!
Kolejka
item.comment: Gift from Alex and Ola

item.name: Loop Inc.
item.comment:
Interesting mechanic, but devolves rapidly into Analysis Paralysis, lengthening player's turns and diminishing the fun. Looking forward to trying out solo mode.
Kickstarter

item.name: Pandemic Legacy: Season 1
item.comment: Can't lend

item.name: Penny Arcade: The Game – Gamers vs. Evil
Penny Arcade: The Game – Rumble in R'lyeh
RESISTOR_
item.comment:
Interesting mechanic. Can be easy to win if you're the first one to make a line, but still chaotic and not assured. Specially the resistor cards, they can turn your good fortune around pretty fast (though in my first 2 games, we tended to discard the resistors, mostly through luck)
Kickstarter

item.name: Samurai Spirit
item.comment: Tough coop. Some samurais seem better with a certain number of players, but there's nothing preventing you from playing with all samurais, even with less than 7 people. I normally hover around 4-5 samurais per game. Tougher than it looks to hit the magical kiai number without going over, and damn those Families! Not a lot of family defense cards in the game, so you better hope that they're picked by samurais that haven't defended a family yet in that night!

item.name: Sanitarium
item.comment:
Bought on impulse, tried a solo game, didn't really gel with me
Edit: Checking the forums, it seems that Asmadi came out with 2.0 rules, that change everything and the game is now really playable and interesting. Will have to retry

item.name: Skull & Roses
item.comment: Black Edition

item.name: Sleuth
item.comment:
Only one play, and people in the group got bored. I like the concept, but it became really difficult to try to pinpoint what everyone had and what the mystery cards were. Some players just made a guess at one point to either blindly win or be out and go do something else. Game went a bit long (hence why random calling was tried by all players).
I'd like to revisit it though, see if another play will show more brilliance, or more boredom.

item.name: Space Alert
item.comment: I prefer losing this game with new players than winning with hardened veterans :p So much laughter.

item.name: Space Alert: The New Frontier
item.comment: The experience and achievement system was a great addition, propelling this awesome game into top contenders.

item.name: Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game
Splendor
item.comment: Great strategy game, with a little bit of luck, that is surprisingly solid and weirdly enough, actually different and enjoyable with any number of players.

item.name: Story War
item.comment:
Storytelling game. If your group isn't creative or doesn't get into the spirit, then it's a dud.
Kickstarter

item.name: Story War Deluxe
item.comment: Kickstarter

item.name: Tokaido
item.comment:
As seen on reddit, this is the most zen, cut-throat game out there. Great art, simple but fun gameplay. Might not stand up to repeated plays, but fun winding down game
Lent to Phil - 20151020

item.name: Tsuro
item.comment:
Simple, elegant, but mostly devolves into "who didn't paint themselves in a corner?"
If you try to stay away from the other dragons as long as possible, while trying to keep the most board space open for you (and thus make it more difficult for other players to encroach without putting themselves in danger), then it's mostly a game of attrition
